TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit SqlServices extends System.Object
public ref class SqlServices abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Supports installing and removing the SQL Server database elements of ASP.NET features.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use SQL Server databases to store information for ASP.NET features such as session state, membership, Web parts personalization, and role management. These features require that the SQL Server database to which they are connected be properly configured before use. You can use the ASP.NET Register SQL tool (aspnet_regsql.exe) to do this, or you can call the static methods exposed by the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> class directly from your code.
> [!NOTE] > Using the aspnet_regsql.exe tool or the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> class to configure the database only sets up the database that the providers will use with the proper tables, triggers, and stored procedures. Configuring the database in this way does not modify configuration files to specify that these features use the SQL Providers for these services.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Management.SqlServices#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.SqlServices/CS/usingsqlservices.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Management.SqlServices#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.SqlServices/VB/usingsqlservices.vb#1)]

Docs.related: Installing the SQL Server Provider Database
Session State Modes

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GenerateApplicationServicesScripts (bool install, System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures features, string database);
.method public static hidebysig string GenerateApplicationServicesScripts(bool install, valuetype System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures features, string database) cil managed
Public Shared Function GenerateApplicationServicesScripts (install As Boolean, features As SqlFeatures, database As String) As String
public: static System::String ^ GenerateApplicationServicesScripts(bool install, System::Web::Management::SqlFeatures features, System::String ^ database);
static member GenerateApplicationServicesScripts : bool * System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures * string -> string

Docs.param: to generate a script that installs the specified features; to generate a script that removes the features.
A bitwise combination of the values, specifying the specific features for which to generate scripts.
The name of the SQL Server database to use in the generated scripts.
Docs.summary: Generates the SQL scripts for the selected features. The scripts will reference the database indicated by the database parameter.
Docs.related: Installing the SQL Server Provider Database

MemberSignature.Value: public static string GenerateSessionStateScripts (bool install, System.Web.Management.SessionStateType type, string customDatabase);

public: static System::String ^ GenerateSessionStateScripts(bool install, System::Web::Management::SessionStateType type, System::String ^ customDatabase);
static member GenerateSessionStateScripts : bool * System.Web.Management.SessionStateType * string -> string

Docs.param: to generate a script that installs the specified features; to generate a script that removes the features.
One of the values, specifying the type of session state for which to generate scripts.
The name of the SQL Server database to use in the generated scripts.
Docs.summary: Generates the SQL script for installing or removing session state. The script will reference the database indicated by the database parameter.
Docs.exception: The type is and the value is not supplied, or the type is either or and the value is not null.
Docs.related: Session State Modes

Docs.summary: Installs components for specified ASP.NET features on a SQL Server database.
Docs.related: Installing the SQL Server Provider Database

MemberSignature.Value: public static void Install (string server, string database, System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures features);
.method public static hidebysig void Install(string server, string database, valuetype System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures features) cil managed
Public Shared Sub Install (server As String, database As String, features As SqlFeatures)
public: static void Install(System::String ^ server, System::String ^ database, System::Web::Management::SqlFeatures features);
static member Install : string * string * System.Web.Management.SqlFeatures -> unit

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The database server on which to install the features.
The database on which to install the features.
A bitwise combination of the values, specifying the features to install.
Docs.summary: Installs components for selected ASP.NET features on a SQL Server database.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If `database` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default database, `aspnetdb`. If `server` is `null` or not supplied, <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> will use the default SQL Server instance.
> [!NOTE] > The connection to the database server is made with a trusted connection.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices.Install%28System.String%2CSystem.String%2CSystem.Web.Management.SqlFeatures%29> method of the <xref:System.Web.Management.SqlServices> class.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Management.SqlServices#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.SqlServices/CS/usingsqlservices.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Management.SqlServices#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.Management.SqlServices/VB/usingsqlservices.vb#4)]

Docs.exception: Unable to connect to the specified database server.
The value contains one or more invalid flags.
An exception occurred while processing the SQL statements required for the operation.
Docs.related: Installing the SQL Server Provider Database
